title: Gradle Quarkus update not working and providing errors
body:
### Describe the bug

I am trying to update my gradle project to quarkus 3 with the gradle command:

`./gradlew -PquarkusPluginVersion=3.0.3.Final quarkusUpdate --stream=3.0`

it is failing with:

```
./gradlew -PquarkusPluginVersion=3.0.3.Final quarkusUpdate --stream=3.0

> Configure project :
Checking for CLOUD Build environment: AWS_CODEBUILD_VERSION=null
Hooks setup not required!

> Task :quarkusUpdate
quarkusUpdate is experimental, its options and output might change in future versions
Instructions to update this project from '2.7.4.Final' to '3.0.4.Final':
The configured Quarkus registries did not provide any compatibility information for the following extensions in the context of the currently recommended Quarkus platforms:
 org.jobrunr:quarkus-jobrunr:5.1.4

Recommended Quarkus platform BOM updates:
Update: io.quarkus.platform:quarkus-bom:pom:2.7.4.Final -> 3.0.0.CR2
Update: io.quarkus.platform:quarkus-amazon-services-bom:pom:2.7.4.Final -> 3.0.0.CR2

Extensions from registry.quarkus.io:
Update: io.quarkiverse.reactivemessaging.http:quarkus-reactive-messaging-http:1.0.7 -> 2.0.0.Alpha

Resolved io.quarkus:quarkus-updates-recipes:1.0.14 with 1 recipe(s) to update from 2.7.4.Final to 3.0.4.Final (initially made for OpenRewrite GRADLE plugin version: 6.7.0) 
The update feature does not yet handle updates of the extension versions. If needed, update your extensions manually.



 ------------------------------------------------------------------------
Executing:
/home/dell/Documents/Projects/Evolphin/secondCheckout/pico-backend/webserver/gradlew --console plain --stacktrace --init-script /tmp/openrewrite-init10109666971377625495gradle rewriteRun

Possible solutions: wait(), wait(long), create(java.lang.Object), with(groovy.lang.Closure), getAt(java.lang.String)
> Could not find method rewrite() for arguments [org.openrewrite:rewrite-java] on object of type org.gradle.api.internal.artifacts.dsl.dependencies.DefaultDependencyHandler.

* Try:
> Run with --info or --debug option to get more log output.
> Run with --scan to get full insights.
```
